column4: hello, in ubuntu 9.04 I cannot use my external usb cdrom, any idea please?
When you say you can't use it, do you mean that you can't see it, or you can't open media...?
it does not recognize the device, it seems,
I can post dmesg, if you like?
Does it show up when you run lsusb ?
in MDV or my previous (k)ubuntu installation it is ok
I will try now
seems not
here is the logs:
[ 9864.908046] usb 2-1: new full speed USB device using ohci_hcd and address 14
[ 9880.115739] usb 2-1: device descriptor read/64, error -110
[ 9895.392042] usb 2-1: device descriptor read/64, error -110
[ 9895.672042] usb 2-1: new full speed USB device using ohci_hcd and address 15
[ 9910.848065] usb 2-1: device descriptor read/64, error -110
!pastebin | xrfang
ok, thanks one moment
If you unplug the device and run lsusb again, which lines disappear (if any)?
NONE disappeared.
Can you switch where you're plugging it in with a currenlty working USB device?
I changed my mouse to that port, it seems ok
And you said this drive works with other OSes, right? What's the model of the drive?
STRANGE, i plugged in the drive in the port I usually use mouse, now it is recognized
